docs.snippet: When the final out was made on another improbable night, and the Kansas City Royals were headed back to the World Series, Ned Yost stood in the dugout and watched....

docs.snippet: Beacons, tiny radio transmitters that send signals to phones close by, have quickly become a new front in the chase to find you whenever and wherever you are....
docs.lead_paragraph: Beacons, tiny radio transmitters that send signals to phones close by, have quickly become a new front in the chase to find you whenever and wherever you are.
docs.abstract: Molly Wood Machine Learning column notes that beacons, tiny radio transmitters that send signals to mobile applications on phones close by, have quickly become new front in advertising industry's attempts to find consumers whenever and wherever they are; notes while they will probably be used for spam for now, devices could make the world around phone users richer, more useful and more interactive.

headline.main: Businesses Are Turning to Beacons, and It’s Going to Be O.K.
headline.print_headline: Businesses Are Beckoning, and It’s Going to Be O.K.

docs.snippet: It’s easy to think that a 74 percent probability is the same as a solid prediction. It’s also a mistake....
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s easy to think that a 74 percent probability is the same as a solid prediction. It’s also a mistake.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; Republicans are in a strong, but not invulnerable, position to take over the Senate; even a 73 chance win probability means there is a 27 percent chance of a loss.

headline.main: How Not to Be Fooled by Odds
headline.print_headline: What Are the Odds? a Closer Look at Probability

byline.contributor: Amanda Cox and Josh Katz contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: In his bid to unseat Nathan Deal, Jason Carter, grandson of former President Jimmy Carter, has focused on high unemployment, underfunded schools and his opponent’s ethics....
docs.lead_paragraph: In his bid to unseat Nathan Deal, Jason Carter, grandson of former President Jimmy Carter, has focused on high unemployment, underfunded schools and his opponent’s ethics.
docs.abstract: Georgia State Senator Jason Carter, grandson of former President Jimmy Carter, has focused in his bid for the governor's seat on high unemployment, underfunded schools and ethics of opponent, Republican Gov Nathan Deal; polls show a near tie between the two candidates, and race may offer rare hope for Democrats in Deep South.

headline.main: Once Again, a Carter Aims to Govern in Georgia
headline.print_headline: Once Again, a Carter Aims to Govern in Georgia

docs.snippet: As the first black superintendent of schools in Selma, Ala., Dr. Roussell aspired to equalize educational opportunity, only to be fired amid racial animosities, protests and a school boycott....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the first black superintendent of schools in Selma, Ala., Dr. Roussell aspired to equalize educational opportunity, only to be fired amid racial animosities, protests and a school boycott.
docs.abstract: Norward Roussell, the first black superintendent of schools in Selma, Ala, who was fired only three years later amid racial animosities and protests that recalled the historic Selma-to-Montgomery civil rights march of 1965, dies at age 80.

headline.main: Norward Roussell, Leader of Selma Schools in Turbulent Time, Dies at 80
headline.print_headline: Norward Roussell, Who Led Schools in Selma in Turbulent Time, Dies at 80
